revised_title: Crystal Symmetry and Molecular Constitution of Organic Compounds
tldr: The author investigates the crystal properties and molecular constitution of various organic compounds, including ethylene, acetylene, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, phosgene, carbon oxysulphide, carbon bisulphide, methyl chloride, dichlormethane, tetrachlormethane, and methyl bromide. The study focuses on their crystal systems, polymorphic changes, and optical properties, providing insights into the relationship between crystal symmetry and molecular structure.
